articles.summary: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha stressed the urgent need for India to lead the Artificial Intelligence (AI) revolution, not trail behind it. He said, 'Ye samay AI ka hai!' (This is the era of AI).

articles.title: How Africa Can Chart Its Own AI Path: From Consumers to Creators
articles.author: Business Ghana
articles.summary: Africa's approach to AI adoption and policy development need not mirror Western models. The continent needs to collaboratively explore potential AI benefits through governmental and private sector policies. Africa has the opportunity to develop its own AI policy on its own and develop its AI industry.

articles.title: AI Language Models Promote Antisemitism and Anti-Israel Bias, ADL Warns
articles.author: The Algemeiner
articles.summary: Major AI language models show anti-Jewish and anti-Israel biases and promote antisemitic tropes, according to a new report from Algi Febri Sugita and ZUMA Press Wire via Reuters Connect. US artificial intelligence company ChatGPT's logo appears on a mobile phone with OPEN AI visible in the background.

articles.title: Meet Manus AI: Your New Digital Butler (don't ask it to make coffee yet)Personal AI assistants
articles.author: Sify
articles.summary: Satyen K. Bordoloi believes that in the future people will have digital assistants like Jarvis in Iron Man and digital girlfriends like in Her. Satyen believes that most of our work happens in the digital domain, so why should our digital assistants only be flesh and blood analogues?

articles.title: 2025 ZGC Forum to spotlight AI
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: The 2025 ZGC Forum Annual Conference will hold the AI Theme Day. It will unveil major developments such as an AI innovation block and Beijing's AI public computing power dispatch platform. There will be two main forums, five thematic forums, and 10 other activities.

articles.title: COMMENTARY: AI can have its own hallucinations
articles.author: The Facts
articles.summary: Technologies that rely on artificial intelligence can have hallucinations, according to the report.      Â   - The New York Times reports that the report is not true. The report also states that the technology can cause hallucinations in some cases.

articles.title: Powered_by Officially Launches The World's First AI Agency for SMBs
articles.author: Longview News-Journal
articles.summary: PoweredBy launches as the world's first AI agency for SMBs. It offers custom AI agent for SMB's. It's the first of its kind in the world. It will help SMBs create their own custom AI agents.

articles.title: Google Now Lets Gemini AI To See Through Your Phone's Camera: What It Offers
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Gemini will use your phone's camera to help you identify places and solve complex problems. Google AI is getting new powers and Gemini will use the camera to identify places, cafes and even solve problems. It will be available on Android and iOS soon.

articles.title: BBB: How to avoid deepfake voicemails
articles.author: Courtesy
articles.summary: AI technology has erased the telltale signs of scam messages. Scammers are using AI to mimic the voice of someone you know and create a phone call or voicemail recording. Anyone with the right software can clone a voice from a very small audio sample. Javascript is required to read premium content.

articles.title: Best AI Essay Writer Tools for Students: Write Smarter, Not Harder
articles.summary: AI essay generator tools are a smarter, faster and more efficient way to generate top-quality essays. It's easier to write an essay than looking for the right words on the computer screen. It is faster and easier to create the essay than a traditional essay generator.

articles.title: South Dakota State researchers aim to accelerate machine learning
articles.author: Sdsu Marketing
articles.summary: Jun Huang, assistant professor at South Dakota State University's Jerome J. Lohr College of Engineering, developed an accelerated framework for machine learning in mobile networks. Huang and Beining Wu, graduate research assistant in SDSU's McComish Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, implemented this framework while conducting research on unmanned aerial vehicles. They believe it will allow for faster and more efficient networking innovations in the 6G technology landscape.
